title: Taxing the rich returns to forefront of French political debate
subhead: The left is more determined than ever to implement a wealth tax. The right opposes it, yet admits that there is a tax equity problem in France. Taxing the most wealthy has once again become a key issue for the 2026 budget.

Europe's 'coalition of the willing' still seeks US backing on Ukraine
subhead: Meeting by videoconference in Paris on Thursday, European leaders and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky hoped for Donald Trump's approval after their promise to offer Kyiv 'security guarantees' should hostilities cease. While no longer openly opposed to this, the US president hesitated.
byline: By Claire Gatinois and Philippe Ricard

title: US economy takes a new hit with too few jobs created in August
subhead: Only 22,000 jobs were created in the US last month, less than a third of what's required to keep up with population growth. The statistic paves the way for the interest rate cuts sought by Donald Trump, but also raises doubts about his administration's economic policy.
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Paris Design Week: A 15th edition marked by abundance
subhead: Some 375 locations across the French capital are hosting, free of charge from September 4 to 13, the very best in contemporary design. From Aude Franjou's textile coral installation to Hugo Falaise's embroidered furniture, here is our selection of must-see works.

title: 'Dear Salman Rushdie…': Isabelle Adjani's stand against religious fundamentalism
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (4/6). After Iran issued a fatwa against the British writer in 1989, the French actress used the César Awards ceremony to show her support for the author of 'The Satanic Verses.' She was one of the few in the film industry to take such a stand.

'Block Everything': Anger in France is deep, but mass strikes appear unlikely
subhead: The choice of a Wednesday for the planned September 10 protests raises questions about who has the option to strike, especially as labor disputes in French workplaces have been particularly rare in recent years.

title: It's pain suisse time! Five places in and around Paris to find this treat
subhead: The recipe for this comforting pastry, enjoyed as a snack or at breakfast? Croissant dough, vanilla custard and chocolate chips. Here is our selection of bakeries offering the best versions.

title: Macron's weakened centrist bloc scrambles to survive ahead of confidence vote
subhead: With the Assemblée Nationale slated to hold a confidence vote that could topple the government next Monday, French President Emmanuel Macron is calling for unity among his ranks. Prime Minister François Bayrou's lack of clear direction has deepened rifts among the various parties within the governing coalition.
